intro: Elleanthus muscicola, commonly known as the muskgrass, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in spikelets. Elleanthus muscicola is adapted to waterlogged soils and plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense vegetation in its natural habitat.
